title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 476.2 - Appointments to certain division positions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 476.2 - Appointments to certain division positions

State Regulations
(a) The Executive Law provides for
appointment to the positions of counsel, assistant counsel, division physician
and assistant division physician. Applicants for such positions must be
citizens of the United States, of good moral character, and must pass a
physical and mental examination and be certified by a physician as qualified
physically to perform the duties of the position. (b) Counsel. For appointment to this
position, the applicant must be a graduate of a resident law school and a
member of the bar of the State of New York, and have such other qualifications
as may be determined by the superintendent. (c) Assistant counsel. For appointment to
this position, the applicant must be a graduate of a resident law school and a
member of the bar of the State of New York, and have such other qualifications
as may be determined by the superintendent. (d) Division physician. For appointment to
the position of division physician, an applicant must possess an M.D. degree, be licensed to practice in the State of New York, and have such other
qualifications as may be determined by the superintendent. (e) Assistant division physician. For
appointment to this position, the applicant must possess an M.D. degree, be
licensed to practice in the State of New York, and have such other
qualifications as may be determined by the superintendent. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9

476.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
